entry.title: Oregon Department of Forestry announces recipients of first Climate Smart Forestry Awards (Photo)
entry.summary: SALEM, Ore. – The Nature Conservancy of Oregon and the Klamath Tribes (represented by Craig Bienz and Steve Rondeau), forest landowners David and Mary Ann Bugni, and Searching for Climate-Smarter Forestry leads Dean Moburg and Peter Hayes were recognized earlier this month by the Oregon Board of Forestry with the Oregon Department of Forestry’s first Climate Smart Forestry Awards, a new honor developed by the agency following adoption of its 2021 Climate Change and Carbon Plan. The award recognizes landowners, land managers, researchers, operators and other forestry professionals who use climate change-adapted practices or develop innovative methods for carbon capture and/or retention, or reduced carbon release. Nominees are considered for exemplary climate smart research and/or innovation…

entry.title: CHI Mercy Medical Center nurses continue months long contract negotiations
